title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CaCO_3$$
text: Use the equation Moles of Reactant A $$=$$ Mass of Reactant A * (Moles of Reactant A)/(Molar Mass of Reactant A).

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CaCO_3$$
text: What is $$(1.31$$ g $$CaCO_3$$ )*(1 mol $$CaCO_3$$ / $$100.09$$ g $$CaCO_3$$ )? Keep three decimal places.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$1$$ mol CO2 / $$1$$ mol $$CaCO_3$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CO_2$$
text: The molar amount of $$CO_2$$ is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of $$CaCO_3$$ by multiplying the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CO_2$$
text: What is $$(0.013$$ mol $$CO_2$$ )*(1 mol $$CO_2$$ / $$1$$ mol $$CaCO_3$$ )? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Mass of $$CO_2$$
text: Calculate the Mass of $$CO_2$$ with Mass of Reactant A $$=$$ (Molar Mass of Reactant A)/(Moles of Reactant A)*Moles of Reactant A)

title: Calculate the Mass of $$CO_2$$
text: What is $$(0.013$$ mol $$CO_2$$ )*(44.01 g $$CO_2$$ )/(mol $$CO_2$$ )? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: Calculate the percentage yield with $$___$$ % yield $$=$$ (Experimental (actual) yield of product C)/(Theoretical (calculated) yield of product C)*100.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: What is $$0.53$$ g $$CO_2$$ /0.572 g $$CO_2$$? Give your answer as an integer.
